question: Is hemoglobin antimicrobial?
ideal_answer:
Yes,
Beyond its physiological activity, hemoglobins are able to inhibit the growth of several microorganisms.

snippets.text: the α137-141 peptide, a natural antimicrobial peptide, can be obtained after hydrolysis of hemoglobin, the main constituent of blood red part
